title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1950.3 - Filing of an affadavit of assets with the petition for probate or administration
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1950.3 - Filing of an affadavit of assets with the petition for probate or administration

State Regulations

Pursuant to the provisions of Part 207
or the Uniform Rules for the Surrogate's Court, ยง
207.1
(c), and

Part 9 of the Rules of the Chief Judge (22 NYCRR Part), it is hereby
ORDERED, that the following shall
constitute a local rule of the Surrogate's Court of Oswego County: "Attorneys shall file an affidavit of
property with the initial filing of a petition for probate or a petition for
administration. Said affidavit should state the personal, real and jointly
owned property of the decedent insofar as the attorney and/or the proposed
fiduciary may be able to provide. Thereafter, a full disclosure of assets shall
be furnished in accordance with the provisions of section
207.20
of the Uniform Rules for

Surrogate's Court."
and it is further
ORDERED, that this rule shall be
effective April 1 1995. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
1950.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
